channel.title: Digital Art on
channel.description: Recent content in Digital Art on

item.title: Expectation
item.description: For my last contribution to ISSIA, I wanted to tackle the social issue that interested me the most, and that was the education system.

item.title: Okja
item.description: This artwork complements an ISSIA article talking about the movie “Okja”, which deals with the social issues of the meat industry and the environment.

item.title: Emelie- Beta Design
item.description: A small doodle of a girl I wrote about in a story.

item.title: Genetic engineering -- benefits over ethics?
item.description: This artwork complements an article from ISSIA called “Genetic engineering – benefits over ethics?

item.title: Social Media: Why Are Some Apps More Successful Than Others?
item.description: This artwork complements an article from ISSIA called “Social Media: Why Are Some Apps More Successful Than Others?

item.title: COVID19
item.description: This artwork complements the many COVID-19 related article from ISSIA.

item.title: Social Credit System
item.description: This artwork complements an international article submission from ISSIA called ‘Human rights activists alert: “Social Credit System” of China is the next massive surveillance act of digital slavery.

item.title: Nihilism within our modern 'work culture'
item.description: This artwork complements an international article submission from ISSIA called ‘Human rights activists alert: “Social Credit System” of China is the next massive surveillance act of digital slavery.

item.title: Podcast Cover
item.description: This artwork is the Official ISSIA Podcast Cover. It depicts two people debating through the speech bubbles in the background.

item.title: Commission for ratscene
item.description: This artwork is a commissioned piece for ratscene through Instagram. It depicts a couple (Kokichi Ouma from DanganronpaV3) (Miu Iruma from DanganronpaV3) falling and reaching out for each other.

item.title: A Life I’ve Come to Miss
item.description: This artwork complements a poem from ISSIA called “A Life I’ve Come to Miss” by Katie Warren

item.title: Doomsday Clock
item.description: This artwork complements an article from ISSIA called “Why You Should Care about Politics” by Daniel Chung

item.title: Why You Should Care about Politics
item.description: This artwork complements an article from ISSIA called “Why You Should Care about Politics” by Daniel Chung

item.title: Commissioned 'Miya Twins'
item.description: This artwork is a commissioned piece which is an extension from the commission “Sakuatsu”.

item.title: Commission for mx.mota
item.description: This artwork is a commissioned piece for mx.mota through Instagram. It depicts a boy called Kaito Momota from “DanganronpaV3”

item.title: The Year 3000
item.description: The final digital work depicts escapism’s role in the future, where the VR Headset streams a nature scene, with clouds creating my own “headspace”.

item.title: 2019 50th Edition Back Page
item.description: This is the Victorian’s 2019 50th Edition Back Page. It reveals the newspaper mascot as a god-like being.

item.title: 2019 Nov Edition Front Page
item.description: Related to one of the articles in the Newspaper, This cover represents an iPhone lock screen.

item.title: Donate to Extend A Life Poster
item.description: This is one of the two advertisement posters I created to promote the 2019 Blood Donation school event.

item.title: Iron Month Poster
item.description: This is one of the two advertisement posters I created to promote the 2019 Blood Donation school event.

item.title: 2018 CAS Edition Front Page
item.description: This is the Victorian’s 2018 CAS Edition Front Page. It also reveals the winning student council of the year.
